isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Disassembly - Optional PTO Assembly on MTC-4208 and -4210 Transfer Cases

svcproc.title: Optional PTO Assembly on MTC-4208 and -4210 Transfer Cases

step1.para: Rotate the transfer case in the repair stand so that the PTO assembly (if so equipped) is facing UPWARD.
Remove the yoke nut, washer and yoke. Use a yoke puller to remove the yoke.
Remove the PTO indicator switch from the shift plate, if equipped.
Remove the cage mounting capscrews and washers from the PTO. Lift the PTO assembly off the transfer case.

warning.para: Take care when you remove the spring-loaded PTO cap. Serious personal injury and damage to components can result.

step1.para: Carefully remove the spring-loaded PTO cap by turning each bolt a few turns at a time until all the bolts can be removed at once.
Remove the capscrews from the cover of the declutch piston. Remove the cover.
Remove the PTO piston push rod and the return spring. Remove the O-ring seal from the PTO piston.
Remove the O-ring seal on the cover. Discard the seal. Remove the shift fork and clutch collar.
Remove the oil and dirt seals from the bearing cage assembly. Discard the seals.
Press the shaft out of the bearing cage. Remove the bearing assembly.
Remove the bearing cups as a unit with the bearing spacer by pressing the cups out of the bearing cage. Do not separate these parts. They are a matched set.
